fullText: Linda Vista is a funny, sad, smart and sprawling portrait of middle-aged male disappointment that feels both bracingly honest and somewhat indulgent.
dtliExcerpt: Linda Vista is a funny, sad, smart and sprawling portrait of middle-aged male disappointment that feels both bracingly honest and somewhat indulgent.
bwwExcerpt: Although it sags a bit in places, it coheres in the end, and Barford and Letts give Wheeler precisely the right amount of rot. The play sees right through this guy, and the view behind him isn't pretty.
showScoreExcerpt: Linda Vista is a funny, sad, smart and sprawling portrait of middle-aged male disappointment that feels both bracingly honest and somewhat indulgent.
